abstract: Profile of Dr Julia Chase-Brand, who is preparing to run in the 4.75-mile Manchester Road Race in Connecticut, where 50 years ago she and two other women ran there the first time in a widely publicized act of civil disobedience; at the time, women were not allowed to run more than a half mile lest they risk their femininity and reproductive health.
snippet: On Thanksgiving, Dr. Julia Chase-Brand, 69, plans to run a race in Manchester, Conn., where 50 years ago she and two other women ran in an act of civil disobedience.
lead_paragraph: On Thanksgiving, Dr. Julia Chase-Brand, 69, plans to run a race in Manchester, Conn., where 50 years ago she and two other women ran in an act of civil disobedience.

headline.seo: Julia Chase-Brand: A Leading Pioneer in Women’s Running
